title: 104_s953
content: The "Black Revolutionary War Patriots Commemorative Coin Act" authorizes the minting of $1 silver coins with specific specifications. The coins will contain 90 percent silver and 10 percent copper, weigh 26.73 grams, and have a diameter of 1.500 inches. The silver for minting will be sourced only from stockpiles established under the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act. SEC. 4. DESIGN OF COINS. The design of the coins minted under this Act will be emblematic of the design selected by the Black Revolutionary War Patriots Foundation for the Black Revolutionary War Patriots Memorial in Washington, D.C. Each coin will have a designation of value, the year "1996" or "1997", and inscriptions of "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum". The design will be selected by the Secretary after consultation with the Black Revolutionary War Patriots Foundation and the Commission of Fine Arts. The design of the coins minted under this Act will be emblematic of the design selected by the Black Revolutionary War Patriots Foundation for the Black Revolutionary War Patriots Memorial in Washington, D.C. The design will be reviewed by the Citizens Commemorative Coin Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities from a single US Mint facility during the period from May 15, 1996, to May 15, 1997. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value of the coins, a surcharge of $10 per coin, and the cost of designing and issuing the coins. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted at a reasonable discount as well. SEC. 7 of the Act waives procurement regulations for goods and services needed for Act implementation, except for equal employment opportunity laws. SEC. 8. DISTRIBUTION OF SURCHARGES. Surcharges from coin sales will be paid to the Black Revolutionary War Patriots Foundation for a memorial in Washington, D.C. The Comptroller General can audit the Foundation's expenditures. SEC. 9. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. SEC. 9. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary must ensure no net cost to the government for minting coins. Payment for coins requires full payment, security, or a guarantee from a depository institution.
